document.docAuthor: Alitto, Renata A. S., Bueno, Maristela L., Guilherme, Pablo D. B., Domenico, Maikon Di, Christensen, Ana Beardsley & Borges, Michela
document.masterDocTitle: Shallow-water brittle stars (Echinodermata: Ophiuroidea) from Araçá Bay (Southeastern Brazil), with spatial distribution considerations

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Shallow-water brittle stars (Echinodermata: Ophiuroidea) from Araçá Bay (Southeastern Brazil), with spatial distribution considerations

bibRefCitation.author: Ljungman, A. V.
bibRefCitation.refString: Ljungman, A. V. (1866) Om nagra nya arter af Ophiurider. Ofversigt af Konglige Vetenskaps-Akademiens Forhandlingar, 1867, 163 - 166.
bibRefCitation.title: Om nagra nya arter af Ophiurider

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type locality.
Rio de Janeiro , Brazil .

subSubSection.paragraph: Material examined. 20 specimens (dd: 2.4–5.5 mm ) from subtidal: ZUEC OPH 2197, St. VII, 1 spm; ZUEC OPH 2210, St. 71, 1 spm; ZUEC OPH 2245, St. XIX, 1 spm; ZUEC OPH 2249, St. XIX, 1 spm; ZUEC OPH 2268, St. 145, 3 spms; ZUEC OPH 2272, St. XXVI, 6 spms; ZUEC OPH 2327, St. 9H, 2 spms; ZUEC OPH 2340, St. 20H, 2 spms; ZUEC OPH 2352, St. XXXIV, 3 spms.

Taxonomic comments. Adoral shields may be joined or separated proximally, depending on the size of the specimen, making this a variable morphological characteristic ( Borges 2006 ). Only two of the analyzed specimens had the adoral shields united proximally. Approximately 80% of the specimens examined were without the dorsal part of the disc.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 14.
Amphipholis januarii
ZUEC OPH 2268 (4.4 mm dd). (A) Dorsal view. (B) Ventral view. (C) Detail of the oral view. (D) Detail of dorsal arm. (E) Detail of ventral arm. (F) Dorsal arm plate. (G) Ventral arm plate. (H-I) Lateral arm plate. (J) Vertebra—proximal surface. (K) Vertebra—distal surface. (L) Vertebra—dorsal surface. (M) Vertebra—ventral surface. Abbreviations: ads: adoral shields; as: arm spine; bs: bursal slits; d: dorsal; dap: dorsal arm plate; ddi: dorso-distal; ddmf: dorso-distal muscular fossae; di: distal; dp: dorso-proximal; ip: infradental papillae; lop: lateral oral papillae; ma: madreporite; mas: middle arm spine; os: oral shields; p: proximal; pe: perforation; rs: radial shields; tn: tentacle notch; ts: tentacle scale; vap: ventral arm plate; v: ventral; vdi: ventro-distal; vp: ventro-proximal; zd: zygoscondyle; zp: zygosphene. Stereomicroscope photos: (A)–(E), scale bar equal to 0.5 mm. SEM photos: (F)–(M), scale bar equal to 100 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph: From 0 to 311 m depth ( Alvarado & Solís-Marín 2013 ). The present study samples occurred at depths ranging from 9 to 21.5 m .
